bug.summary: Unexpected behavior when load pre-trained word2vec
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
I got [E094] Error reading line 50 in vectors file ... when I tried to load my own pre-train Gensim word2vec in .txt fotmat. I track down the exception and find it is raised here: https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/blob/master/spacy/cli/init_model.py#L184 Should it be line.rsplit(' ', vectors_data.shape[1]) ? For example, if we have a n-dimension wordvec, there should be n+1 columns for each row. To split the row into n+1 elements(1 word + n-d vec), we only need to split it n+1-1=n times. line.rsplit(' ', vectors_data.shape[1] + 1) may cause problem when a word token contains whitespaces. <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.16 Platform: Darwin-17.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.7.3
